thread.title: Blue ACLU ribbons make a statement on the Oscars red carpet - LA Times
thread.title_full: Blue ACLU ribbons make a statement on the Oscars red carpet - LA Times

author: Nardine Saad
title: Blue ACLU ribbons make a statement on the Oscars red carpet - LA Times
text:
Feb. 26, 2017, 4:15 p.m. Blue ACLU ribbons make a statement on the Oscars red carpet Model Karlie Kloss. (Frazer Harrison/Getty Images) 
Academy Award attendees on Sunday made activism a must-have red-carpet accessory. 
Those blue ribbons affixed to the formal attire worn by model Karlie Kloss, original song nominee Lin-Manual Miranda, "Loving" nominee Ruth Negga and "Moonlight" director Barry Jenkins represent the American Civil Liberties Union's new "Stand With ACLU" initiative. 
By wearing the pin, the celebrities are showing their support â€œfor the rights and civil liberties guaranteed by the Constitution to everyone in the United States," the ACLU said in a statement. 
"I'm wearing an ACLU ribbon because they're fighting incredible fights right now for American ideals," Miranda said . (Jordan Strauss / Invision / Associated Press) Oscar-nominated "Moonlight" director Barry Jenkins. (Amy Kaufman / Los Angeles Times) "Loving" nominee Ruth Negga. (Richard Shotwell /Invision/AP)
